document_data.name: Yorkshire pudding
document_data.mainbody: '''Yorkshire pudding''' was a dish eaten in [[Damara]]. It was served alongside the main courses of feasts, accompanying fares such as suckling [[pig]], [[wine pudding]], and [[bread pudding]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1358}}, Baron [[Tranth]] of [[Bloodstone (barony)|Bloodstone]] served Yorkshire pudding as part of a grand feast meant to welcome and woo [[adventurers]] led by [[Gareth Dragonsbane]] in hopes that they might help free [[Bloodstone Village]] from the predations of the [[Bandit Army]] in service of the [[Grandfather of Assassins]].
